``` ::: ::: ::: ## Optimizers ### SGD ::: {#45879a2a .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} class SGD: def __init__(self, params, lr, wd=0.): params = list(params) fc.store_attr() self.i = 0 def step(self): with torch.no_grad(): for p in self.params: self.reg_step(p) self.opt_step(p) self.i +=1 def opt_step(self, p): p -= p.grad * self.lr def reg_step(self, p): if self.wd != 0: p *= 1 - self.lr*self.wd def zero_grad(self): for p in self.params: p.grad.data.zero_() ``` ::: ::: {#dadcadb4 .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} set_seed(42) model = get_model(act_gr, norm=nn.BatchNorm2d).apply(iw) learn = TrainLearner(model, dls, F.cross_entropy, lr=0.4, cbs=cbs, opt_func=SGD) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: Consider the difference between *weight decay* and *L2 regularization*: ``` python weight -= lr*wd*weight ``` ...vs... ``` python weight.grad += wd*weight ``` ### Momentum ::: {#bc3b109f .cell execution_count=9} ``` {.python .cell-code} xs = torch.linspace(-4, 4, 100) ys = 1 - (xs/3) ** 2 + torch.randn(100) * 0.1 ``` ::: ::: {#a3a478a6 .cell execution_count=10} ``` {.python .cell-code} _,axs = plt.subplots(2,2, figsize=(12,8)) betas = [0.5,0.7,0.9,0.99] for beta,ax in zip(betas, axs.flatten()): ax.scatter(xs,ys) avg,res = 0,[] for yi in ys: avg = beta*avg + (1-beta)*yi res.append(avg) ax.plot(xs,np.array(res), color='red'); ax.set_title(f'beta={beta}') ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=10} ``` Text(0.5, 1.0, 'beta=0.5') ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=10} ``` Text(0.5, 1.0, 'beta=0.7') ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=10} ``` Text(0.5, 1.0, 'beta=0.9') ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=10} ``` Text(0.5, 1.0, 'beta=0.99') ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](12_accel_sgd_files/figure-html/cell-11-output-5.png){width=962 height=653} ::: ::: ::: {#a8879ffa .cell execution_count=11} ``` {.python .cell-code} class Momentum(SGD): def __init__(self, params, lr, wd=0., mom=0.9): super().__init__(params, lr=lr, wd=wd) self.mom=mom def opt_step(self, p): if not hasattr(p, 'grad_avg'): p.grad_avg = torch.zeros_like(p.grad) p.grad_avg = p.grad_avg*self.mom + p.grad*(1-self.mom) p -= self.lr * p.grad_avg ``` ::: ::: {#59ff0c0b .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.python .cell-code} set_seed(42) model = get_model(act_gr, norm=nn.BatchNorm2d).apply(iw) learn = TrainLearner(model, dls, F.cross_entropy, lr=1.5, cbs=cbs, opt_func=Momentum) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: ### RMSProp ::: {#0d75f586 .cell execution_count=15} ``` {.python .cell-code} class RMSProp(SGD): def __init__(self, params, lr, wd=0., sqr_mom=0.99, eps=1e-5): super().__init__(params, lr=lr, wd=wd) self.sqr_mom,self.eps = sqr_mom,eps def opt_step(self, p): if not hasattr(p, 'sqr_avg'): p.sqr_avg = p.grad**2 p.sqr_avg = p.sqr_avg*self.sqr_mom + p.grad**2*(1-self.sqr_mom) p -= self.lr * p.grad/(p.sqr_avg.sqrt() + self.eps) ``` ::: ::: {#70507dec .cell execution_count=16} ``` {.python .cell-code} set_seed(42) model = get_model(act_gr, norm=nn.BatchNorm2d).apply(iw) learn = TrainLearner(model, dls, F.cross_entropy, lr=3e-3, cbs=cbs, opt_func=RMSProp) learn.fit(3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: ### Adam ::: {#50c7a08d .cell execution_count=18} ``` {.python .cell-code} class Adam(SGD): def __init__(self, params, lr, wd=0., beta1=0.9, beta2=0.99, eps=1e-5): super().__init__(params, lr=lr, wd=wd) self.beta1,self.beta2,self.eps = beta1,beta2,eps def opt_step(self, p): if not hasattr(p, 'avg'): p.avg = torch.zeros_like(p.grad.data) if not hasattr(p, 'sqr_avg'): p.sqr_avg = torch.zeros_like(p.grad.data) p.avg = self.beta1*p.avg + (1-self.beta1)*p.grad unbias_avg = p.avg / (1 - (self.beta1**(self.i+1))) p.sqr_avg = self.beta2*p.sqr_avg + (1-self.beta2)*(p.grad**2) unbias_sqr_avg = p.sqr_avg / (1 - (self.beta2**(self.i+1))) p -= self.lr * unbias_avg / (unbias_sqr_avg + self.eps).sqrt() ``` ::: ::: {#0e339e38 .cell execution_count=19} ``` {.python .cell-code} set_seed(42) model = get_model(act_gr, norm=nn.BatchNorm2d).apply(iw) learn = TrainLearner(model, dls, F.cross_entropy, lr=6e-3, cbs=cbs, opt_func=Adam) learn.fit(3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: ## Schedulers We've already seen how we can easily write a custom LR-adjusting callback or `Learner`, or can use the predefined PyTorch schedulers. We'll use the predefined ones for now since there's nothing new to learn in implementing them ourselves. ::: {#ad572c09 .cell execution_count=20} ``` {.python .cell-code} ' '.join(o for o in dir(lr_scheduler) if o[0].isupper() and o[1].islower()) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-error} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}
